meanings.definition: To draw back or tense the body, as from pain or from a blow; start; flinch.
meanings.sent1: She winced when the doctor touched her bruise.
meanings.sent2: He winced as the cold wind blew against his face.
meanings.sent3: The puppy winced playfully when tickled on its belly.
meanings.sent4: The loud noise made her winced in surprise.
meanings.sent5: The child winced at the sight of the scary movie.

meanings.definition: To shrink or start involuntarily, as in pain or distress.
meanings.sent1: He winced at the thought of having to take a test.
meanings.sent2: She winced slightly when she saw the spider crawling towards her.
meanings.sent3: The clown's silly dance made the audience winced in mock horror.
meanings.sent4: The old house winced under the weight of the heavy snow on its roof.
meanings.sent5: The teacher winced as the students loudly dropped their books.
